issue.title: [bug] Can't run Tauri on a different thread

repository.name: tao
repository.description: The TAO of cross-platform windowing. A library in Rust built for Tauri.

issue.body:
> This issue has been upstreamed from https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/3172 

### Describe the bug

I can't run Tauri on a different thread, neither there is any flag/feature to do it.

### Reproduction

1. Run this https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/next/examples/helloworld/src-tauri/src/main.rs
2. But instead of running it in the main thread, run it like something like:

```rust
fn main() {
    std::thread::spawn(|| {
        tauri::Builder::default()
        .run(tauri::generate_context!(
          "../../examples/helloworld/src-tauri/tauri.conf.json"
        ))
        .expect("error while running tauri application");
    });
    
    std::thread::park();
}
```

### Expected behavior

Be able to run it in a different thread, rather than the main one.

### Platform and versions

```shell
Operating System - Windows, version 10.0.19043 X64
Webview2 - 96.0.1054.62

Node.js environment
  Node.js - 17.1.0
  @tauri-apps/cli - 1.0.0-beta.10

Global packages
  npm - 7.5.4
  yarn - 1.22.17

Rust environment
  rustc - 1.59.0-nightly
  cargo - 1.58.0-nightly
```


### Stack trace

```shell
thread '<unnamed>' panicked at 'Initializing the event loop outside of the main thread is a significant cross-platform compatibility hazard. If you really, absolutely need to create an EventLoop on a different thread, please use the `EventLoopExtWindows::new_any_thread` function.', C:\Users\mespi\.cargo\registry\src\github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823\tao-0.5.2\src\platform_impl\windows\event_loop.rs:152:5
stack backtrace:
   0: std::panicking::begin_panic<str>
             at /rustc/6db0a0e9a4a2f55b1a85954e114ada0b45c32e45\library\std\src\panicking.rs:525
   1: tao::platform_impl::platform::event_loop::EventLoop<enum$<tauri_runtime_wry::Message> >::new<enum$<tauri_runtime_wry::Message> >
             at C:\Users\mespi\.cargo\registry\src\github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823\tao-0.5.2\src\platform_impl\windows\event_loop.rs:152
   2: tao::event_loop::EventLoop<enum$<tauri_runtime_wry::Message> >::with_user_event<enum$<tauri_runtime_wry::Message> >
             at C:\Users\mespi\.cargo\registry\src\github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823\tao-0.5.2\src\event_loop.rs:131
   3: tauri_runtime_wry::impl$36::new
             at .\tauri\core\tauri-runtime-wry\src\lib.rs:1554
   4: tauri::app::Builder<tauri_runtime_wry::Wry>::build<tauri_runtime_wry::Wry,tauri_utils::assets::EmbeddedAssets>
             at .\tauri\core\tauri\src\app.rs:895
   5: tauri::app::Builder<tauri_runtime_wry::Wry>::run<tauri_runtime_wry::Wry,tauri_utils::assets::EmbeddedAssets>
             at .\tauri\core\tauri\src\app.rs:1040
   6: degui::impl$0::run::closure$1
             at .\src\lib.rs:74
```


### Additional context

I am working on my own tauri bindings for Deno, and bacause I don't want to block Deno's main thread, I need to run it in another thread.

Just to test if running it in another thread would give any issue, I manually edited https://github.com/tauri-apps/tao/blob/f8866a084afe18983c91c67401d8759697578a9c/src/event_loop.rs#L132



To:

```rust
pub fn with_user_event() -> EventLoop<T> {
    EventLoop {
      event_loop: platform_impl::EventLoop::new_any_thread(), // <- edited "new()" to "new_any_thread()"
      _marker: ::std::marker::PhantomData,
    }
}
```

So, instead of calling `EventLoop::new()` which will trigger the panic, it lets me run tauri on a  different thread.  I thought that maybe there could be some kind of flag / feature, so `with_user_event()` doesn't call `EventLoop::new()` but instead, it calls `EventLoop::new_any_thread()` .

I can open this issue in `tao`'s repository if you prefer.

body: I have created an upstream issue at https://github.com/tauri-apps/tao/issues/272, I will notify you once it is resolved.
Thanks for the report, we'll expose this.
Note that we don't have new_any_thread on Linux. And I'm afraid gtk won't allow that.

@marc2332 maybe you can merge our event loop with deno?
Also I think you should use tao and wry directly for better access to the low level interfaces.

> @marc2332 maybe you can merge our event loop with deno? 

Sorry, what exactly do you mean? (Edit: I get it now)

> Also I think you should use tao and wry directly for better access to the low level interfaces.

Good idea!

Note: it will also panic on MacOS: 
- https://github.com/tauri-apps/tao/blob/a3a2e0cfc49ddfa8cdf65cf9870fb8e3d45b4bc0/src/platform_impl/macos/event_loop.rs#L112
- https://github.com/tauri-apps/tao/blob/a3a2e0cfc49ddfa8cdf65cf9870fb8e3d45b4bc0/src/platform_impl/macos/window.rs#L353

But, on MacOS, there is no possible workaround  hehe

issue.title: [help] MacOS Support

repository.name: astrodon
repository.description: Make Desktop apps with Deno ðŸ¦•

issue.body:
While tauri on Linux and Windows (with a workaround) can run on a different thread rather than the main, MacOS can't. This is essential, because we don't want to block the main thread (Deno's). We hope there is a better way to do it (maybe without running tauri on ffi side?). 

We are open to suggestions and contributions :)

Related: https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/3172

body: Any chance this will be fixed for macOS?
@medzernik As far as we know there is no way to fix this for macOS, it's a hard-requirement to run the event loop on the main thread.

> o

so basically the only way for me to have two input grabbing threads on macOS is to split them using something like gRPC into 2 processes that communicate I guess? Shame.. but understandable :/

issue.title: Roadmap: Other Bindings?

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
Is there any issue to track the `Other Bindings` roadmap entry? 
If not, maybe this one could be used for those of us that wish to subscribe to any updates.

Various discussions/issues regarding bindings, loading alternative runtimes with sidecars, migrating from electron/node, etc:

- [Question about whether tauri will support webserver](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/discussions/2537)
- [Bun?](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/discussions/5837)
- [Electron to tauri system](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/discussions/1223)
- [how to use a JavaScript module built for node.js](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/discussions/2592)
- [Node to Deno rust .js](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/discussions/2572)
- [QuickJS instead of Deno for app backend!](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/discussions/1131)
- [Node server doesn't starts on it's own](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/discussions/2174)
- [Rebuilding an Electron Desktop app with Tauri](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/discussions/4873)
- [Executing python scripts using Tauri](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/discussions/1645)
- [Question about whether tauri will support webserver](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/discussions/2537)
- [[feat] Electron to Tauri](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/6142)
- [[bug] Sidecar example fails to produce working Appimage](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/5445)
- [How to run nodejs server in build mode ?](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/1773)
- [Headless Tauri](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/1061)
- [[bug] Can't run Tauri on a different thread](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/3172)
- [How to implement another Backend Service (like C#/ .NET) ](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/5174)

issue.title: Callback not being called

repository.name: node-ffi-rs
repository.description: Implement ffi in Node.js by Rust and NAPI

issue.body:
## Current ffi-rs version

Print current Node.js info with the following code

$ cat node_modules/ffi-rs/package.json

```json
{
  "name": "ffi-rs",
  "version": "1.0.86",
  "main": "index.js",
  "types": "index.d.ts",
  "description": "A module written in Rust and N-API provides interface (FFI) features for Node.js",
  "napi": {
    "name": "ffi-rs",
    "triples": {
      "additional": [
        "aarch64-apple-darwin",
        "aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu",
        "aarch64-unknown-linux-musl",
        "i686-pc-windows-msvc",
        "x86_64-unknown-linux-musl",
        "aarch64-pc-windows-msvc"
      ]
    }
  },
  "author": "zhangyuang",
  "homepage": "https://github.com/zhangyuang/node-ffi-rs#readme",
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git+https://github.com/zhangyuang/node-ffi-rs.git"
  },
  "keywords": [
    "ffi",
    "rust",
    "node.js",
    "napi"
  ],
  "files": [
    "index.js",
    "index.d.ts",
    "README.md"
  ],
  "license": "MIT",
  "dependencies": {},
  "devDependencies": {
    "@napi-rs/cli": "^2.15.2",
    "@types/node": "^20.8.7",
    "benny": "^3.7.1",
    "conventional-changelog-cli": "^4.1.0",
    "esno": "^4.0.0",
    "ffi-napi": "^4.0.3",
    "koa": "^2.14.2",
    "shelljs": "^0.8.5",
    "typescript": "^5.4.5"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "artifacts": "napi artifacts",
    "build:c": "node scripts/compile.js",
    "build:dev": "env=development node scripts/build.js",
    "build": "node scripts/build.js",
    "publish:npm": "node scripts/publish.js",
    "test": "esno ./test.ts",
    "changelog": "conventional-changelog -p angular -i CHANGELOG.md -s -r 0 && git add . && git commit -m \"docs: update changelog.md\" && git push origin master",
    "pub": "npm version patch && git push origin master --tags && npm run changelog",
    "pub:alpha": "npm version prerelease --preid=alpha && git push origin master --tags"
  },
  "optionalDependencies": {
    "@yuuang/ffi-rs-darwin-arm64": "1.0.86",
    "@yuuang/ffi-rs-darwin-x64": "1.0.86",
    "@yuuang/ffi-rs-linux-arm64-gnu": "1.0.86",
    "@yuuang/ffi-rs-linux-arm64-musl": "1.0.86",
    "@yuuang/ffi-rs-linux-x64-gnu": "1.0.86",
    "@yuuang/ffi-rs-linux-x64-musl": "1.0.86",
    "@yuuang/ffi-rs-win32-arm64-msvc": "1.0.86",
    "@yuuang/ffi-rs-win32-ia32-msvc": "1.0.86",
    "@yuuang/ffi-rs-win32-x64-msvc": "1.0.86"
  }
}
```

$ ls node_modules/@yuuang

ls node_modules/@yuuang
ffi-rs-darwin-arm64

## Current Node.js arch

Print current Node.js info with the following code

node -v                                              
v20.15.1
âžœ  node git:(main) bun -v      
1.1.18

$ node -e "console.log(process.arch, process.platform)"

```console
node -e "console.log(process.arch, process.platform)"
arm64 darwin
```
## Descibe your problem in detail

I created bindings using ffi-rs to [tauric](https://github.com/thewh1teagle/tauric/blob/main/c-api/src/lib.rs)
I have a function called `on_ready` that accept function pointer and it's being called after `run` is called and ready.
I register it in [bindings/node/index.ts#L25](https://github.com/thewh1teagle/tauric/blob/main/bindings/node/index.ts#L25).
In nodejs it desn't being called.
In bun.js when register it I get error:

```console
bun run index.js  
thread '<unnamed>' panicked at src/utils/dataprocess.rs:246:54:
called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: Error { status: Unknown, reason: "Get field \"needFree\" received Boolean(false) but params type only supported number or object ", maybe_raw: 0x0 }
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
fatal runtime error: failed to initiate panic, error 5
[1]    2267 abort      bun run index.js
```
You can see that with python bindings it works:
[bindings/python/main.py](https://github.com/thewh1teagle/tauric/blob/main/bindings/python/main.py)

## What's your expect result
The callback that passed should being called few moments after run is called.

## The reproduction repo address
https://github.com/thewh1teagle/tauric
